operations.description: Make details unclear or less distinct.

operations.name: WarpStabilize

result.description: Smooth Motion = smoothed at a variable rate, preserving camera motion. No Motion = All motion has been removed in order to make a shot appear as though it was attached to a surface.

method.description: Position = Stabilization is based on position data only and is the most basic way footage can be stabilized. Position, Scale and Rotation = Stabilization is based on manipulations to the frame that change the size, orientation, and location. Perspective  = Uses a type of stabilization in which the entire frame is effectively corner-pinned. If there are not enough areas to track, Warp Stabilizer chooses the previous type (Position, Scale, Rotation). Subspace Warp = Attempts to warp various parts of the frame differently to stabilize the entire frame. If there are not enough areas to track, Warp Stabilizer choose the previous type (Perspective).

boarders.description: Stabilize Only - Displays the entire frame, including the moving edges. Stabilize, Crop = Crops the moving edges without scaling. Stabilize, Crop, Auto-scale = Crops the moving edges and scales up the image to refill the frame. Stabilize, Synthesize Edges =  Fills in the blank space created by the moving edges with content from frames earlier and later in time.

operations.name: TimeAlterationEcho

Echo Time.description: The time, in seconds, between echoes. Negative values create echoes from previous frames; positive values create echoes from upcoming frames.

Number of Echos.description: The number of echoes. For example, if the value is 2, the result is a combination of three frames: the current time, the current time + Echo Time, and the current time + (2 * Echo Time).

Starting Intensities.description: The opacity of the first image in the echo sequence

Operator.description: The operation used. For example: Add,Maximum,Minimum,Screen,Composite In Back,Composite In Front and Blend

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.name: TimeAlterationDifferenceEffect

Time Offset.description: The relative time in the comparison layer, in seconds, where the layers are compared

Target Layer.description: Target layer number to be compared to the effect layer

Alpha Channel.description: Specifies how the alpha channel is calculated.

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Calculate the color difference between two layers as a useful aid in color correction

operations.name: TimeAlterationDisplacementEffect

Max Displacement Time.description: Sets the maximum time, in seconds, from which pixels are replaced, before or after the current time.

Time Resolution.description: Sets the number of frames per second in which to replace pixels

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Distorts the image by shifting pixels across time.

operations.name: TimeAlterationWarp

Method.description: The Method setting determines how interpolated frames are generated.

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

Vector Detail.description: Determine how many motion vectors are used during interpolation. The more vectors used, the longer the rendering time. A value of 100 produces one vector per pixel.

Smoothing.description: These controls affect the sharpness of the image.

Weighting.description: Weighting red, green, and blue channels in calculations used to analyze the image.  Suggest comma-separated values for RGB.

Adjust Time By.description: Choose Speed to specify a time adjustment as a percentage

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Alter frame rate and frame blending to change playback rate. Vector Detail is a integer that determines how many motion vectors are used during interpolation. Methods include 'Whole Frames', 'Frame Mix' and 'Pixel Motion'. Adjust Time By controls is a percentage of reduction.

operations.name: ImageInterpolation

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

inputmaskname.description: An image file containing a mask describing the areas affected.

operations.description: Replace large selections with an averaging of surrounding pixel groups.

operations.name: TransformAffine

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

homography.description: Tune transform creation for composite mask generation

homography max matches.description: Maximum number of matched feature points used to compute the homography.

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Apply a linear mapping method that preserves points, straight lines, and planes

operations.name: TransformContentAwareScale

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

homography.description: Tune transform creation for composite mask generation

composite homography.description: Use a single transform or one per probe mask component

homography max matches.description: Maximum number of matched feature points used to compute the homography.

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Resize an image without changing important visual content.

operations.name: TransformCrop

location.description: Tuple in form of (x,y) describing the upper left crop corner.

operations.description: Removing edge content from an image. For video, remove data from certain areas of the frame.

operations.name: TransformDistort

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

inputmaskname.description: An image file containing a mask describing the areas affected.

homography.description: Tune transform creation for composite mask generation

homography max matches.description: Maximum number of matched feature points used to compute the homography.

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Alter the shape and dimensions of a given selection or image.

operations.name: TransformFlip

inputmaskname.description: An image file containing a mask describing the areas affected.

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Reverse pixel coordinates of an image or selection along a vertical or horizontal axis.

operations.name: TransformMove

inputmaskname.description: An image file containing a mask describing the component that was moved.

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

homography.description: Tune transform creation for composite mask generation

homography max matches.description: Maximum number of matched feature points used to compute the homography.

use input mask for composites.description: Override JT decision to use the input mask in composite generation

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Reposition a selection within a larger composition.

operations.name: TransformResize

interpolation.description: Interpolation is used to resize entire composite images. 'none' indicates a canvas size increase.

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

inputmaskname.description: An image file containing a mask of the component that was moved

homography.description: Tune transform creation for composite mask generation

homography max matches.description: Maximum number of matched feature points used to compute the homography.

operations.description: Alter the dimensions of an image.

operations.name: TransformRotate

rotation.description: The rotation should be provided in degrees counter-clockwise (ex. -90 for clockwise, 90 for counterclockwise)

local.description: Rotate entire image or a local selection

Start Time.description: Start time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

homography.description: Tune transform creation for composite mask generation

homography max matches.description: Maximum number of matched feature points used to compute the homography.

End Time.description: End time of the image clip (HH:MI:SS.micro or frame number)

operations.description: Alter the angle of display for an image or layer.  The image dimensions may resized to accomodate the rotation.

homography.description: Tune transform creation for composite mask generation

homography max matches.description: Maximum number of matched feature points used to compute the homography.

operations.description: Change the size of an image or layer while preserving dimensions.

operations.name: TransformSeamCarving

inputmaskname.description: An image file containing a mask describing preserved and sliced areas

homography.description: Tune transform during composite mask generation

composite homography.description: Use a single transform or one per probe mask component

homography max matches.description: Maximum number of matched feature points used to compute the homography.

row adjuster.description: An 16 unsigned bit mapping indices image file directing the change in pixels row from space to another

column adjuster.description: An 16 unsigned bit mapping indices image file directing the change in pixels column from space to another

neighbor mask.description: A 8 unsigned but image file indicating which pixels in the resulting image  had neighbors removed or added

plugin mask.description: A 8 unsigned but image file indicating which pixels in the source image were removed

operations.description: Resize an image while preserving the integrity of content.
